English Sentences: To another the working of miracles; to another prophecy; to another discerning of spirits; to another divers kinds of tongues; to another the interpretation of tongues:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asa ubbaa maaddanau, Geeshsha Ayyaanaa qonccissiyo wolqqai ubbaayyo huuphiyan huuphiyan imettiis.

English Sentences: But all these worketh that one and the selfsame Spirit, dividing to every man severally as he will.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Geeshsha Ayyaanai issuwaassi aadhdhida eratettaa haasayaa immees; qassi issuwaassi eratettaa haasayaa immees.

English Sentences: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also is Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: He Geeshsha Ayyaanai issuwaassi ammanuwaa immidi, hinkkuwaassi hargganchchaa pattiyo wolqqaa immees.

English Sentences: For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, whether we be Jews or Gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all made to drink into one Spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geeshsha Ayyaanai issuwaassi Xoossai oottiyo malaataa oottiyo wolqqaa immidi, issuwaassi hananabaa yootiyo wolqqaa immees. Issuwaassi ayyaanatu gidduwan de7iya dummatettaa eriyo wolqqaa immidi, issuwaassi dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyo wolqqaa immees. Qassi issuwaassi dumma dumma qaalan haasayidoogaa birshshiyo wolqqaa immees

English Sentences: For the body is not one member, but many.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha ubbabaa oottiyaagee he issi Geeshsha Ayyaanaa. Asa ubbaassi i ba koyiyoogaadan, dumma dumma imuwaa shaakki shaakkidi immees.

English Sentences: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosi daro qommoti de7iyo issi bolla mala. Bollai daro qommotuppe merettidabaa gidikkokka, issi bolla.

English Sentences: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore not of the body?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, nuuni Aihuda asa gidikkonne woi Giriike asa gidikko, woi aille gidikkonne woi goqa gidikko, ubbai issi Geeshsha Ayyaanan issi bolla gidanau xammaqettida. Qassi nuuni ubbaikka issi Geeshsha Ayyaanaa uyida.

English Sentences: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, bollaassi qommoi daro gidiyoogaappe attin, issuwaa gidenna.

English Sentences: But now hath God set the members every one of them in the body, as it hath pleased him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tohoi, "Taani kushe gidenna gishshau, bollaa qommo gidikke" giikko, i hegaa giyoogee bollaa qommo gidiyoogaa digganee?

English Sentences: And if they were all one member, where were the body?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haittaikka, "Taani aife gidenna gishshau, bollaa qommo gidikke" giikko, i hegaa giyoogee bollaa qommo gidiyoogaa digganee?

English Sentences: But now are they many members, yet but one body.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bolla ubbai aife xalaala gidiyaakko, waatidi siyanau danddayii? Qassi bolla ubbai haitta xalaala gidiyaakko, waatidi singganau danddayii?

English Sentences: And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossai ba koyidoogaadan, bollaa qommota issuwaa issuwaa bollan wottiis.

English Sentences: Nay, much more those members of the body, which seem to be more feeble, are necessary:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbai issi qommo gidiyaakko, bollai awan de7anee?

English Sentences: And those members of the body, which we think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant honour; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin qommoti daro gidikkokka, bollai issuwaa.

English Sentences: For our comely parts have no need: but God hath tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to that part which lacked:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aifee kushiyaa, "Neeni tana koshshakka" gaanau danddayenna. Woikko qassi huuphee tohota, "Intte tana koshshekketa" gaanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: That there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin laafa milatiya bollaa qommoti daro koshshiyaageeta.

English Sentences: And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bollaa qommotuppe bonchchettennabaa nuussi milatiyaageeta nuuni daro bonchcheettees. Qassi nuna yeellayiya bollaa qommotakka keehi bonchcheettees.

English Sentences: Now ye are the body of Christ, and members in particular.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nu bollaappe lo77iya baggaa bonchchoi koshshenna; shin bonchchoi pacciyo bollaa qommotussi aadhdhiya bonchchuwaa immanau, Xoossai bollaa issippe gattiis.

English Sentences: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily prophets, thirdly teachers, after that miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, diversities of tongues.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bollaa qommoti issoi issuwaassi issi mala qofaa qoppanaappe attin, bollan dummatetti de7anau bessenna.

English Sentences: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?
Wolaitta Sentences: Bollaa qommotuppe issoi seelettikko, bollaa qommoti ubbaikka aara seelettoosona; bollaa qommotuppe issoi bonchchettikko, bollaa qommoti ubbai aarakka ufaittoosona.

English Sentences: Have all the gifts of healing? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai Kiristtoosa bolla; qassi huuphiyan huuphiyan intte ubbaikka a bollaa qommota.

English Sentences: But covet earnestly the best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excellent way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai woosa keettan issi issi asata, koiruwan Yesuusi kiittidoogeeta, naa77anttuwan hananabaa yootiyaageeta, heezzanttuwan tamaarissiyaageeta, hegaappe guyyiyan, Xoossai oottiyo malaataa oottiyaageeta, hegaappe guyyiyan, pattiyo wolqqai de7iyoogeeta, maaddiyaageeta, woosa keettaa aissiyaageetanne dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyaageeta oottiis.

English Sentences: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, and have not charity, I am become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbati Yesuusi kiittidoogeetee? Ubbati hananabaa yootiyaageetee? Ubbati tamaarissiyaageetee? Ubbati Xoossai oottiyo malaataa oottiyoonaa?

English Sentences: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaassi pattiyo wolqqai de7ii? Ubbati dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyoonaa? Qassi dumma dumma qaalan haasayidobaa ubbati birshshiyoonaa?

English Sentences: And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ubbaappe aadhdhiya imuwaa minttidi koyite. Qassi ubbaappe keehi aadhdhiya ogiyaa taani inttena bessana.

English Sentences: Charity suffereth long, and is kind; charity envieth not; charity vaunteth not itself, is not puffed up,
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani asa qaalaaninne kiitanchcha qaalan haasayikkokka taassi siiqoi xayikko, ta haasayai kilddi giya daala mala; woikko chachachi giya shappo mala.

English Sentences: Doth not behave itself unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easily provoked, thinketh no evil;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyo imoi taassi de7iyaakkokka, taani geema yoho ubbaanne eratetta ubbaa eriyaakkokka, qassi deriyaa harasaa efiyo ammanoi taassi de7iyaakkokka, siiqoi xayikko, taani aibanne gidikke.

English Sentences: Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taassi de7iyaabaa ubbaa hiyyeesata mizanau immiyaakkokka harai atto, ta bollaa taman xuugganau aatta immiyaakkokka siiqoi xayikko, tana ainne go77enna.

English Sentences: Beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiqoi danddayanchcha. Siiqoi kehees. Siiqoi qanaatenna. Ceeqettenna; qassi otorettenna.

English Sentences: Charity never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they shall fail; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there be knowledge, it shall vanish away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiqoi baassi bessennabaanne oottenna. Uuzettenna. Yiillotenna. Siiqoi naaqettidobaakka paidenna.

English Sentences: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiqoi tumatettan ufaittiyoogaappe attin, wordduwan ufaittenna.

English Sentences: But when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in part shall be done away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiqoi ubbabaa danddayees. Ubbabaikka hanana giidi, ufaissan naagees. Ubbabaa genccees.

English Sentences: When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiqoi mulekka xayenna. SHin hananabaa yootiyoogeekka xayana. Dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyoogeekka attana. Eratettaikka xayana.

English Sentences: For now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, nuuni eratettaappe baggaa ereettees; hananabaa yootiyoogaappekka baggaa yooteettees.

English Sentences: And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin kumettai yiyo wode, baggai xayana.

English Sentences: Follow after charity, and desire spiritual gifts, but rather that ye may prophesy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani naatettan de7iyo wode, na7adan haasayais. Na7adan qoppais. Qassi na7adankka akeekais. Wodalla gidido wode, naatetta hanuwaa xaissaas.

English Sentences: For he that speaketh in an unknown tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ha77i be7iyoogee heregan be7iyo lem77i lem77iya mera mala; shin he wode nuuni nu aifiyan qoncciyan be7ana. Ha77i taani eratettaappe baggaa erais; shin Xoossai tana wurssidi eriyoogaadan, he wode taanikka wurssa erana.

English Sentences: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification, and exhortation, and comfort.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hegaa gidikko, ammanoi, hanana giidi ufaissan naagiyoogeenne siiqoi, hageeti heezzai minnidi de7oosona. De7inkka hageetuppe aadhdhiyaagee siiquwaa.

English Sentences: He that speaketh in an unknown tongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siiquwaa kaallite. Ayyaanaa imuwaakka minttidi koyite. SHin ubbaappe aattidi, hananabaa yootiyoogaakka koyite.

English Sentences: I would that ye all spake with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied: for greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiya urai Xoossaassi haasayeesippe attin, asassi haasayenna. Aissi giikko, i haasayiyoogaa ooninne akeekenna. SHin asassi qonccibeenna yohuwaa Ayyaanaa wolqqan haasayees.

English Sentences: Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hananabaa yootiyaagee asa maaddanau, zoranaunne minttettanau asassi haasayees.

English Sentences: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?
Wolaitta Sentences: Dumma dumma qaalan haasayiya urai bana maaddees. SHin hananabaa yootiyaagee woosa keettaa maaddees.

English Sentences: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai dumma dumma qaalan haasayanaagaa taani dosais. SHin hananabaa yootanaagaa hegaappe aattada dosais. Aissi giikko, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyaagee he haasayidoogaa woosa keettaa maaddanau birshshiya asi xayikko, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyaagaappe hananabaa yootiyaagee aadhdhees.

English Sentences: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall speak into the air.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ta ishatoo, ha77i taani inttekko baada, dumma dumma qaalan haasayaidda, ajjuutan woi eratettan woi hananabaa yootiyoogan woi tamaarissiyoogan inttessi yootana xayikko, taani inttena ai go77iyaanaa?

English Sentences: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of them is without signification.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harai atto, shemppoi bainnabai pulaale gidin woikko diitta gidin giiriiddi, ba giirettaa dummatettaa erissana xayikko, pulaale punniyaakkonne, woi diitta diixxiyaakko, asi waatidi eranee?

English Sentences: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh shall be a barbarian unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi malkkataa waasoi geeyidi erettana xayikko, olaassi oonee giigettanai?

English Sentences: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi dumma dumma qaalan intte haasayiyoogee qoncce gidennan xayikko, intte haasayiyoogaa asi waatidi akeekanee? Aissi giikko, carkkuwaassi intte haasayeeta.

English Sentences: Wherefore let him that speaketh in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha sa7an daro qaalai de7ennan aggenna; qassi birshshetti bainna qaali issoinne baawa.

English Sentences: For if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin issi asi haasayiyo qaalaa taani erana xayikko, he haasayiyaagee taassi imatta gidees; taanikka assi imatta gidais.

English Sentences: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi Geeshsha Ayyaanaa imuwaa intte ekkanau minttidi koyiyaageeta gidiyo gishshau, woosa keettaa dichchanau maaddiyaabaa ubbabaappe aattidi koyite.

English Sentences: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyaagee ba haasayidobaa birshshanau danddayana mala, Xoossaa woosso.

English Sentences: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani dumma dumma qaalan Xoossaa woossikko, ta ayyaanaikka woossees; shin ta wozanaa qofai ainne go7ettenna.

English Sentences: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, taani waatoo? Taani ta ayyaanan Xoossaa woossana; qassi ta qofankka Xoossaa woossana. Ta ayyaanan yexxana; qassi ta qofankka yexxana.

English Sentences: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gidana xayikko, neeni ne ayyaanaa xalaalan Xoossaa galatiyaabaa gidikko, he sohuwan neeni giyoogaa erenna asi neeni Xoossaa galatiyoogaa erennan, neeni galatidoogan woigidi, "Amin77i" gaanee?

English Sentences: Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni Xoossaa lo77o galataasa; shin hegee hinkko bitaniyaa maaddenna.

English Sentences: In the law it is written, With men of other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani dumma dumma qaalan intte ubbaappe aattada haasayiyo gishshau, Xoossaa galatais.

English Sentences: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to them that believe not: but prophesying serveth not for them that believe not, but for them which believe.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani woosa keettan harata tamaarissanau dumma dumma qaalan tammu sha7u qaalata haasayiyoogaappe ichchashu qaalata ta wozanaa qofan haasayanau dosais.

English Sentences: If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those that are unlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, intte iita yohuwan yiira mala gidanaappe attin, qofan na7a mala gidoppite; intte wozanaa qofan wozannaamata gidite.

English Sentences: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, or one unlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa maxaafan, "Godai, Taani ha asaassi, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiya asaaninne imattatu doonaan haasayana. SHin hegaa gidikkokka, taani giyoobaa eti siyokkona yaagees" geetettidi xaafettiis.

English Sentences: And thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so falling down on his face he will worship God, and report that God is in you of a truth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyoogee ammanennaageetussi malaata gidiyoogaappe attin, ammaniyaageetussi malaata gidenna. Qassi hananabaa yootiyoogee ammaniyaageetussi malaata gidiyoogaappe attin, ammanennaageetussi malaata gidenna.

English Sentences: How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, woosa keettaa asai ubbai issippe shiiqidi, qassi ubbaikka dumma dumma qaalan haasayikko, tamaaribeenna asai woi ammanenna asai gelidi, inttena ubbaa, "Gooyeeta" geenneeyye?

English Sentences: If any man speak in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and that by course; and let one interpret.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin tamaaribeenna asi woi ammanenna asi woosa keettaa geliyo wode, asai ubbai hananabaa yootikko, i ba siyoban ba nagaraa akeekana. Qassi he siyidobaa ubbankka i pirddettana.

English Sentences: But if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.
Wolaitta Sentences: A wozanaa geema qofaikka qonccana. Hegaadankka qassi, "Xoossai tumu intte giddon de7ees" yaagidi markkattiiddi, gufannidi Xoossaassi goinnana.

English Sentences: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the other judge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi ta ishatoo, aibee? Intte issippe shiiqiyo wode, huuphiyan huuphiyan, issuwaassi mazamuree de7ees; issuwaassi tamaarissiyoogee de7ees; issuwaassi ajjuutai de7ees; qassi issuwaassi dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyoogee de7ees; issuwaassi birshshiyoogee de7ees. Ubbaikka woosa keetta maaddiyaabaa gidanau bessees.

English Sentences: If any thing be revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooninne dumma dumma qaalan haasayikko, naa77u gididi, woi darikko heezzu gididi, kayan kayan haasayanau bessees. Qassi hara issoi eti haasayidoogaa birshsho.

English Sentences: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin birshshiya asi xayikko, dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyaagee woosa keettan sirphphi go. Ba huuphessinne Xoossaassi haasayo.

English Sentences: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyaageetikka naa77u gididi woi heezzu gididi haasayona. Qassi harati eti giyoobaa pirddona.

English Sentences: For God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossai he sohuwan uttida haraassi issibaa qonccissikko, kase haasayiyaagee sirphphi go.

English Sentences: Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but they are commanded to be under obedience, as also saith the law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ubbai tamaarana malanne ubbai minnana mala, kayan kayan hananabaa yootanau danddayeeta.

English Sentences: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hananabaa yootiyaageetu imoi hananabaa yootiyaageetussi azazettees.

English Sentences: What? came the word of God out from you? or came it unto you only?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai sarotettaa Xoossaappe attin, wocamaa Xoossaa gidenna. Geeshshatu woosa keetta ubbatuugaadan,

English Sentences: If any man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: maccaasai woosa keettan sirphphi go. Aissi giikko, Aihudatu higgee giyoogaadankka eti haarettanaappe attin, woosa keettan haasayanau etau maati baawa.

English Sentences: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maccaasai woosa keettan haasayiyoogee pokko gidiyo gishshau, aibakko eranau koyikkonne sooni bantta azinata oichchona.

English Sentences: Wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa qaalaa koiro intte ehiidetii? Woikko intte xalaalaakko yiidee?

English Sentences: Let all things be done decently and in order.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooninne bana hananabaa yootiyaagaa woi Ayyaanai de7iyo asa yaagidi qoppikko, taani intteyyo xaafiyoogee Godaa azazuwaa gidiyoogaa akeeko.

English Sentences: Moreover, brethren, I declare unto you the gospel which I preached unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ooninne akeekana xayikko, akeekoppo, aggi bayo.

English Sentences: By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memory what I preached unto you, unless ye have believed in vain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ta ishatoo, hananabaa yootanau minttidi amottite. Qassi dumma dumma qaalan haasayiyoogaakka diggoppite.

English Sentences: For I delivered unto you first of all that which I also received, how that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ubbabaikka wogaaninne maaran hano.

English Sentences: And that he was buried, and that he rose again the third day according to the scriptures:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, taani intteyyo yootido wonggeliyaa intte ekkidoogaanne qassi intte ammanoi aani eqqidoogaa inttena hassayissais.

English Sentences: And that he was seen of Cephas, then of the twelve:
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ammanoi hada gidana xayikko, qassi taani intteyyo yootido qaalaa mintti oiqqikko, intte he wonggeliyan attideta.

English Sentences: After that, he was seen of above five hundred brethren at once; of whom the greater part remain unto this present, but some are fallen asleep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani qassi ekkidoogaa ubbabaappe aadhdhidi koshshiyaagaa kasetada inttessi immaas. Hegee aibee giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai giyoogaadan, Kiristtoosi nu nagaraa gishshau haiqqiis.

English Sentences: After that, he was seen of James; then of all the apostles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqidi moogettiis. Xoossaa maxaafai giyoogaadankka, heezzantto gallassi haiquwaappe denddiis.

English Sentences: And last of all he was seen of me also, as of one born out of due time.
Wolaitta Sentences: Denddidi, PHeexiroosassi qoncciis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, ba kiittido tammanne naa77atussi qoncciis.

English Sentences: For I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, ichchashu xeetaappe dariya ishatussi issitoo qoncciis. Etappe dariya baggai hanno gakkanaassikka paxa de7ees; shin amaridaageeti haiqqidosona.

English Sentences: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Yaaqoobassi qoncciis; guyyeppe ba kiittido ubbatussi qoncciis.

English Sentences: Therefore whether it were I or they, so we preach, and so ye believed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi ubbaappe wurssettan, wodee gakkennan yelettida taassikka qoncciis.

English Sentences: Now if Christ be preached that he rose from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Yesuusi kiittido ubbaappe taani laafa; taani Xoossaa woosa keettaa waissido gishshau, Yesuusi kiittidoogaa geetettada xeesettanaukka bessikke.

English Sentences: But if there be no resurrection of the dead, then is Christ not risen:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossaa aaro kehatettan taani tanakka. Qassi taassi i immido aaro kehatettai hada gidibeenna; shin taani eta ubbaappe aattada oottaas. SHin tanaara de7iya Xoossaa aaro kehatettai oottiisippe attin, tana gidikke.

English Sentences: And if Christ be not risen, then is our preaching vain, and your faith is also vain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi tana gidikkokka, woikko eta gidikkokka, nuuni ubbai yootiyoogee hagaa; inttekka hagaa ammanideta.

English Sentences: Yea, and we are found false witnesses of God; because we have testified of God that he raised up Christ: whom he raised not up, if so be that the dead rise not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosi haiquwaappe denddidoogaa yootiyoobaa gidikko, intteppe issi issi asati yaatin woigidi, "Haiqqidabai haiquwaappe denddenna" yaagiyoonaa?

English Sentences: For if the dead rise not, then is not Christ raised:
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqida urai haiquwaappe denddibeennabaa gidikko, yaatin hekko Kiristtoosikka haiquwaappe denddibeenna giyoogaa.

English Sentences: And if Christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosi haiquwaappe denddibeennabaa gidikko, yaatin nuuni yootiyoogeekka mela; qassi intte ammanoikka mela.

English Sentences: Then they also which are fallen asleep in Christ are perished.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi nuuni, "Kiristtoosa haiquwaappe denttiis" yaagidi Xoossaa bolli markkattido gishshau, a worddo markkata gididi beettida. SHin haiqqidaageeta haiquwaappe i denttibeennabaa gidikko, Kiristtoosakka denttibeenna.

English Sentences: If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, haiqqidaageeti haiquwaappe denddennabaa gidikko, simmi Kiristtoosikka denddibeenna.

English Sentences: But now is Christ risen from the dead, and become the firstfruits of them that slept.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoosi haiquwaappe denddibeennabaa gidikko, intte ammanoikka mela; qassi intte hanno gakkanaassikka nagaraara de7eeta.

English Sentences: For since by man came death, by man came also the resurrection of the dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi Kiristtoosa ammanidi haiqqidaageetikka qassi xayidosona giyoogaa.

English Sentences: For as in Adam all die, even so in Christ shall all be made alive.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ha de7uwaa xalaalaassi Kiristtoosa yainnidabaa gidikko, ha sa7an de7iya asa ubbaappekka nubai pala.

English Sentences: But every man in his own order: Christ the firstfruits; afterward they that are Christ's at his coming.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Kiristtoosi haiqqidaageetu dendduwaassi baira gididi, haiquwaappe denddidoogee tuma.

English Sentences: Then cometh the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to God, even the Father; when he shall have put down all rule and all authority and power.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, haiqoi issi asa baggaara ha sa7aa yiidoogaadan, haiqqidaageetu denddoikka qassi issi asa baggaara yiis.

English Sentences: For he must reign, till he hath put all enemies under his feet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, asai ubbai Addaameera dabbotido gishshau haiqqidoogaadan, Kiristtoosaara dabbotido gishshau, ubbai de7uwaassi denddana.

English Sentences: The last enemy that shall be destroyed is death.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ubbaikka ba kayan kayan denddana. Kiristtoosi ubbaappe kasetidi denddiis; hegaappe guyyiyan, Kiristtoosaageeti Kiristtoosi yiyo wode denddana.

English Sentences: For he hath put all things under his feet. But when he saith all things are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which did put all things under him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Kiristtoosi halaqatetta ubbaa, godatetta ubbaanne wolqqaanne xaissidi, Xoossaassi ba Aawaassi kawotettaa immiyo wode, wodiyaa wurssettai yaana.

English Sentences: And when all things shall be subdued unto him, then shall the Son also himself be subject unto him that put all things under him, that God may be all in all.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai a morkketa ubbaa a tohuwaappe garssaara wottana gakkanaassi, Kiristtoosi haaranau bessees.

English Sentences: Else what shall they do which are baptized for the dead, if the dead rise not at all? why are they then baptized for the dead?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaappe wurssettan xayana morkkee haiquwaa.

English Sentences: And why stand we in jeopardy every hour?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossaa maxaafai, "Xoossai ubbabaa a tohuwaappe garssaara wottidi haarissiis" yaagees. SHin ubbabaa a tohuwaappe garssaara wottidi haarissiis giyo wode, ubbabaa haarissida Xoossaappe attin, hinkko ubbai haarettiis giyoogee qoncce.

English Sentences: I protest by your rejoicing which I have in Christ Jesus our LORD, I die daily.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ubbabai Kiristtoosassi haarettidoogaappe guyyiyan, Kiristtoosi qassi ba huuphen ubbabaa bana haarissida Xoossaassi haarettana. Xoossai qassi ubbabaa wurssidi haarana.

English Sentences: If after the manner of men I have fought with beasts at Ephesus, what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink; for to morrow we die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gidana xayikko, haiqqidaageetussi xammaqettiyaageeti ai oottiyoonaa? Haiqqidaageeti mulekka denddennabaa gidikko, asai haiqqidaageetussi aissi xammaqettii?

English Sentences: Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, nuuni ubba wode aissi hassayenna metuwan geliyoonii?

English Sentences: Awake to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, taani nu Godaa Kiristtoosi Yesuusan taassi de7iya intte ceequwan ceeqqaidda, wonttin wonttin haiqqais.

English Sentences: But some man will say, How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Efisoonan asadan do7aara baaxetidoogee tana ai go77anee? SHin haiqqidaageeti haiquwaappe denddibeennabaa gidikko, "Simmi moosinne uyoos; aissi giikko, nuuni wontto haiqqana" yaagiyoogaa mala.

English Sentences: Thou fool, that which thou sowest is not quickened, except it die:
Wolaitta Sentences: Cimettoppite; iita laggetettai lo77o hanotettaa moorees.

English Sentences: And that which thou sowest, thou sowest not that body that shall be, but bare grain, it may chance of wheat, or of some other grain:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettaakko simmite. Nagara oottoppite. Intteppe issi issi asai Xoossaa erenna; taani hagaa inttena yeellayanau gais.

English Sentences: But God giveth it a body as it hath pleased him, and to every seed his own body.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin issi asi, "Haiqqida asai waanidi denddanee? Eti ai mala bollaara yaanee?" yaagennan aggenna.

English Sentences: All flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh of men, another flesh of beasts, another of fishes, and another of birds.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nenoo eeyyau, neeni biittan zeriyo zerettai wooqqennan mokkenna.

English Sentences: There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni zeriyoogee gistte gidin woi hara qommo katta gidin, aife xalaalappe attin, mokkidi kiyiya bollaa gidenna.

English Sentences: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossai zerettaassi ba dosido bollaa immees; qassi zeretta ubbaassikka huuphiyan huuphiyan eta bollaa immees.

English Sentences: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption:
Wolaitta Sentences: Mereta ubbaa ashoi issuwaa gidenna. SHin asa ashoi issuwaa; mehiyaa ashoi dumma; kafotu ashoikka dumma; qassi moliyaa ashoikka dumma.

English Sentences: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi saluwaa bollatinne sa7aa bollati de7oosona. SHin saluwaa bollaa bonchchoi dumma; qassi sa7aa bollaa bonchchoi dumma.

English Sentences: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body, and there is a spiritual body.
Wolaitta Sentences: Awa aifiyaassi a huuphe bonchchoi de7ees. Aginaassikka a huuphe bonchchoi de7ees. Qassi xoolinttetussikka dumma bonchchoi de7ees; aissi giikko, issi xoolinttee hinkko xoolinttiyaappe bonchchuwan dummatees.

English Sentences: And so it is written, The first man Adam was made a living soul; the last Adam was made a quickening spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi haiqqidaageeti haiquwaappe denddiyo wode hegaadan hanana; haiqqiya bollai moogettidi, haiqqenna bolla gididi denddana.

English Sentences: Howbeit that was not first which is spiritual, but that which is natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bollai tooshiyan moogettidi, bonchchuwan denddana. Qassi daafuran moogettidi, wolqqan denddana.

English Sentences: The first man is of the earth, earthy: the second man is the Lord from heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mereta bollai moogettidi, ayyaana bollaa gididi denddana. Mereta bollai de7ikko, qassi ayyaanaa bollaikka de7ees.

English Sentences: As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi Xoossaa maxaafan, "Koiro bitanee, Addaamee, paxa de7iya asa gidi merettiis" yaagees. SHin wurssetta Addaamee de7uwaa immiya ayyaana gidiis.

English Sentences: And as we have borne the image of the earthy, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin mereta asi koiro yin, geedoppe ayyaana asi yiisippe attin, ayyaanaagee koiro yibeenna.

English Sentences: Now this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God; neither doth corruption inherit incorruption.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiro Addaamee biittaappe merettiis; i biittaappe merettidaagaa. Naa77antto Addaamee saluwaappe yiis.

English Sentences: Behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittaageeti biittaappe merettidaagaa mala. Qassi saluwaageeti saluwaappe yiidaagaa mala.

English Sentences: In a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni biittaappe merettidaagaa meraa maayidoogaadan, saluwaappe yiidaagaa meraakka qassi maayana.

English Sentences: For this corruptible must put on incorruption, and this mortal must put on immortality.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, taani giyoogee hagaa; ashoinne suutti Xoossaa kawotettaa laattana danddayenna. Qassi musiyaagee musennaagaa laattenna.

English Sentences: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyite! Taani intteyyo issibaa xuurana. Nuuni ubbai haiqqokko.

English Sentences: O death, where is thy sting? O grave, where is thy victory?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin wurssetta malkkatai punettiyo wode, liphida aifee xeellanaassi hassayennan laamettana. Aissi giikko, malkkatai punettiyo wode, haiqqida asai musenna asa gididi denddana; nuunikka laamettana.

English Sentences: The sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hagee musiyaagee musennaagaa maayanau bessees; qassi hagee haiqqiyaageekka haiqqennaagaa maayanau bessees.

English Sentences: But thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hagee musiyaagee musennaagaa maayiyo wode, qassi hagee haiqqiyaagee haiqqennaagaa maayiyo wode, he wode, Xoossaa maxaafai, "Haiqoi xoonettidi mitettiis.

English Sentences: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiquwau, ne yiishshai awaanee? Haiquwau, ne xoonoi awaanee?" giido qaalai polettana.

English Sentences: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqoi dukkiyo wolqqaa nagaraappe demmees; qassi nagarai wolqqaa higgiyaappe demmees.

English Sentences: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa baggaara nuna xoonissiya Xoossaa galatai gakko.

English Sentences: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani siiqiyo ta ishatoo, hegaa gishshau, qaaxxennan minnidi eqqite. Intte daafurai Godaa baggaara mela gidennaagaa eridi, ubba wode Godaa oosuwaa azallennan oottite.

English Sentences: And if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geeshshatussi miishshaa shiishshanau Galaatiyaa woosa keettatussi taani maacidoogaadan, inttekka qassi hegaadan oottite.

English Sentences: Now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte taani yaa biyo wode, miishshaa shiishshenna mala, intte ubbai Woggaa gallassi gallassi, intte demmiyo keenaappe intte keettan dagayite.

English Sentences: And it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani yaa gakkiyo wode, intte ammaniyo asa oona gidikkonne, intte immidoogaa gattana mala, dabddaabbiyaara eta Yerusalaame kiittana.

English Sentences: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi taani etaara baanau koshshikko, eti tanaara issippe baana.

English Sentences: But I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Maqidooniyaara aadhdhaidda, inttekko baana; aissi giikko, taani Maqidooniyaara aadhdhais.

English Sentences: For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani biyoosaa awa gidikkonne, ta buussan intte tana maaddana mala, intte matan amarida wodiyaa gam77ennan aggikke. Woikko balgguwaakka intte matan shaaccennan waayada aggana.

English Sentences: Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani ha77i yaara aadhdhaidda oge tohuwaara inttena be7anau koyikke. Godai giikko, intte matan amarida wodiyaa takkanau qoppais.

English Sentences: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani PHenxxaqosxxe giyo gallassai gakkanaassi Efisoonan gam77ana.

English Sentences: As touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taassi oosoi kumido aaho penggee yaani dooyettiis. Qassi taassi daro morkketi de7oosona.

English Sentences: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ximootiyoosi inttekko yiikko, intte matan i yayyennan de7anaadan, a loitti wottite. Aissi giikko, ikka qassi Godaa oosuwaa oottees.

English Sentences: Let all your things be done with charity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ooninne a karoppo. SHin i taakko saro simmana mala, a maaddidi sarotettan moissite. Aissi giikko, taani i ishanttuura simmanaagaa naaga uttaas.

English Sentences: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin nu ishaa Aphiloosi hinkko ishanttuura inttekko baana mala, taani a mintta woossaas. SHin ha77i inttekko baanau koyibeenna; i baayyo injjetiyo wode inttekko baana.

English Sentences: That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tishshi giite. Ammanuwan minnite. Xalite. Minnite.

English Sentences: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooso ubbaa siiquwan oottite.

English Sentences: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, Isxxifaanoosinne a so asai Giriiken koiro ammanidaageeta gidiyoogaanne geeshshatussi oottanau banttana immidoogaa intte ereeta.

English Sentences: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttekka eta mala asaassinne, etaara oottiya ubbaassi daafuriya ubbaassi haarettanaadan, taani inttena woossais.

English Sentences: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isxxifaanoosi, Parddonaaxisinne Akaiqoosi intte bainnasan tana boorasiyaa teqqido gishshau, eta yuussaa taani ufaittais.

English Sentences: The salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti inttena ayyaanan minttettidoogaadan, tanakka ayyaanan minttettido gishshau, hegeeta mala asata dogoppite.

English Sentences: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
Wolaitta Sentences: Isiyaa woosa keettaa asai inttena, "Saro saro" goosona. Aqiilinne PHirisqqila bantta soo shiiqiya woosa keettaa asaarakka intteyyo Godaa sarotaa wozanappe kiittoosona.

English Sentences: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ishantti ubbai inttessi sarotaa kiittoosona. Issoi issuwaa geeshsha yerettaa yerettidi sarotite.

English Sentences: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani PHauloosi ha sarotaa ta kushiyan xaafaas.
